title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's masterpiece explores racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of a young girl in the American South.
author: Harper Lee

description: George Orwell's dystopian novel depicts a totalitarian regime where individuality and truth are suppressed.
author: George Orwell

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's classic romance explores social class, manners, and love in early 19th-century England.
author: Jane Austen

title: Moby-Dick
description: Herman Melville's epic tale follows Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge against the white whale.
author: Herman Melville

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's novel portrays the angst and alienation of a teenager in 1950s America.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: Frankenstein
description: Mary Shelley's Gothic novel explores themes of ambition, creation, and the consequences of playing God.
author: Mary Shelley

title: The Great Gatsby
description: F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel delves into the American Dream and the decadence of the Jazz Age.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: Brave New World
description: Aldous Huxley's novel presents a futuristic society where technology and conditioning control human behavior.
author: Aldous Huxley

title: Jane Eyre
description: Charlotte Brontë's novel tells the story of an orphaned governess who falls in love with her enigmatic employer.
author: Charlotte Brontë

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: Mark Twain's novel follows the adventures of a young boy and a runaway slave as they travel down the Mississippi River.
author: Mark Twain

title: Neverwhere
description: Neil Gaiman's fantasy novel follows Richard Mayhew as he discovers the hidden world of London Below and embarks on a quest to help Door, a young woman from this mysterious realm.
author: Neil Gaiman

title: The Time Traveler's Wife
description: Audrey Niffenegger's novel tells the love story of Clare Abshire and Henry DeTamble, a man with a genetic disorder that causes him to time travel unpredictably.
author: Audrey Niffenegger

title: The Shadow of the Wind
description: Carlos Ruiz Zafón's novel follows Daniel Sempere as he discovers a mysterious book and becomes entangled in its secrets, leading him on a journey through post-war Barcelona.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

title: Eragon
description: Christopher Paolini's fantasy novel follows the story of a young farm boy named Eragon who discovers a dragon egg and becomes embroiled in an ancient conflict.
author: Christopher Paolini

title: The Lovely Bones
description: Alice Sebold's novel narrated by Susie Salmon, a young girl who was murdered and watches from her personal Heaven as her family and friends cope with her death.
author: Alice Sebold

title: The Princess Diaries
description: Meg Cabot's novel follows Mia Thermopolis as she navigates high school, friendships, and romance while discovering she's the heir to the throne of a small European principality.
author: Meg Cabot

title: His Dark Materials: The Golden Compass
description: Philip Pullman's fantasy novel follows Lyra Belacqua as she embarks on a journey to the Arctic to rescue kidnapped children and uncover a sinister plot.
author: Philip Pullman

title: The Name of the Wind
description: Patrick Rothfuss' fantasy novel follows the life of Kvothe, a gifted young man who grows up to become the most notorious wizard his world has ever seen.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: Dan Brown's thriller follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder in the Louvre and uncovers a centuries-old conspiracy.
author: Dan Brown

title: Memoirs of a Geisha
description: Arthur Golden's historical novel tells the story of Sayuri, a young Japanese girl who trains to become a geisha in pre-World War II Japan.
author: Arthur Golden
